citation: Proclamation under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, on the recommendation of the Minister and with the consent of the owner of the land, by this my proclamation made under section 14A of the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 â€“

        (a) declare the land specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of private nature reserve; and
        (b) give the name Long Spit Private Nature Reserve to that reserved land; and
        (c) declare that this proclamation does not have effect until it is registered in accordance with section 16A of that Act.
6 September 1999

G. S. M. GREEN

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

D. E. LLEWELLYN

Minister for Primary Industries, Water and Environment

SCHEDULE 1 - Plan

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 15 September 1999

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Primary Industries, Water and Environment.
